title: Authors and Citation
text: Neil Charles. Maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Charles N (2023). baRb: Interface BARB's Spot API. R package version 0.3.0.9000.
code: @Manual{,   title = {baRb: Interface to BARB's Spot API},   author = {Neil Charles},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.3.0.9000}, }

title: Interface to BARB's Spot API
text: Functions working BARB’s TV spot API

title: Interface to BARB's Spot API
Interface to BARB's Spot API
text: BaRb requires username password set using environment variables. Use commands set .Renviron file. Get list available advertisers : spot list specific advertiser : Official documentation BARB’s API can found .
code: Sys.setenv(BARB_API_USERNAME = "username") Sys.setenv(BARB_API_PASSWORD = "password") barb_get_advertisers() barb_get_spots(   min_transmission_date = "2023-01-01",   max_transmission_date = "2023-01-31",   advertiser_name = "hays_travel")

what: Make a request to the barb async API — async_barb
title: Make a request to the barb async API — async_barb
text: Send request barb API. lightweight general purpose request generating function requests barb API async endpoints can used workhorse query async API endpoints.

title: Make a request to the barb async API — async_barb
code: async_barb(   path,   ...,   output_format = c("csv", "parquet"),   token = NA_character_ )

title: Make a request to the barb async API — async_barb
text: path route request endpoint. appended API base URL. ... arguments used build query parameters output_format character(1), one "csv", "parquet", determines type data files generated download. token character(1) barb API token. NA try find session default token

title: Make a request to the barb async API — async_barb
text: list response endpoint

title: Make a request to the barb async API — async_barb
text: Async requests successfully initiated automatically added tracked current R session. See async_sitrep

title: Get/check status of result — async_barb_result
text: async job processed, response contain progress information allowing users track completion status.

title: Get/check status of result — async_barb_result
Get/check status of result — async_barb_result
text: job_id character(1) job id returned initiating request async_barb token character(1) barb API token. NA try find session default token.

title: Get/check status of result — async_barb_result
text: list raw response json

title: Get/check status of result — async_barb_result
text: Possible statuses: * started  * successful  * failed job completed, response provide final result, consists array files can downloaded uers. result includes two types files * CSV Files: unload data CSV files apply gzip compression reduce data size. * Parquet Files: also provide option unload data Parquet files, offer columnar storage efficient compression. use Snappy compression algorithm Parquet files, ensuring balance compression ratio processing speed.

what: Check the status of async requests — async_sitrep
title: Check the status of async requests — async_sitrep
text: query current status async endpoint requests generated current R session.

title: Check the status of async requests — async_sitrep
Check the status of async requests — async_sitrep
text: tibble uuid Unique identifier resource created_at character(n) time stamp request initiation status Current execution status report, one "started", "successful", "failed" result list(character(n)) results, available, files download

what: Get a tibble of spots from the BARB API — barb_get_programmes
title: Get a tibble of spots from the BARB API — barb_get_programmes
text: Get tibble spots BARB API

title: Get a tibble of spots from the BARB API — barb_get_programmes
code: barb_get_programmes(   min_transmission_date = NULL,   max_transmission_date = NULL,   station_code = "",   macro_regions = FALSE,   consolidated = TRUE,   use_reporting_days = FALSE )

title: Get a tibble of spots from the BARB API — barb_get_programmes
text: min_transmission_date Start date spot query max_transmission_date End date spot query station_code station code obtained barb_get_stations() macro_regions whether return macro standard region areas consolidated whether return consolidated live viewing. Defaults TRUE (consolidated). use_reporting_days whether use standard 24 hour clock BARB reporting clock. Defaults FALSE (standard 24 hour clock).

title: Get a tibble of spots from the BARB API — barb_get_programmes
text: tibble TV spots

what: Get a tibble of spots from the BARB API — barb_get_spots
title: Get a tibble of spots from the BARB API — barb_get_spots
text: Get tibble spots BARB API

title: Get a tibble of spots from the BARB API — barb_get_spots
code: barb_get_spots(   min_transmission_date = NULL,   max_transmission_date = NULL,   advertiser_name = NULL,   macro_regions = FALSE,   consolidated = TRUE,   use_reporting_days = FALSE,   standardise_audiences = "" )

title: Get a tibble of spots from the BARB API — barb_get_spots
text: min_transmission_date Start date spot query max_transmission_date End date spot query advertiser_name Advertiser name. Get names barb_get_advertisers() macro_regions whether return macro standard region areas consolidated whether return consolidated live viewing. Defaults TRUE (consolidated). use_reporting_days whether use standard 24 hour clock BARB reporting clock. Defaults FALSE (standard 24 hour clock). standardise_audiences whether standardise impacts spot time length. Options default standardisation (""), "using_duration" "using_rate_factors".

title: Get a tibble of spots from the BARB API — barb_get_spots
text: tibble TV spots

title: Submit a query to the BARB API (usually not called directly) — barb_query_api
code: if (FALSE) { # Example only. You'd use barb_get_spots() for this instead. raw_json <- barb_query_api(   "https://dev.barb-api.co.uk/api/v1/advertising_spots",   list(     min_transmission_date = "2022-01-01",     max_transmission_date = "2022-12-31",     advertiser_name = "PLAYMOBIL UK") ) }
